gall noun
(SOLID MASS)
[ C ] a gall is a kind of unusual solid mass that forms on the outer tissues of plants: The galls deform the leaves and stems of the host tree. One of the best plants to examine for galls is an oak tree.
More examplesFewer examplesSome insect larvae can cause galls on vine leaves.No galls were observed on any of the naturally occurring seedlings.Rose galls occur on leaves or stems of the rose plant.
